channel.title: Help finding area/perimeter of shape! =O
channel.description:
[shadow=red,left]I need to find the area && perimeter of the shape below... I have hard time doing those shapes;my geometry is not that good.... [s]:([/s] [/shadow]
[IMG]http://i280.photobucket.com/albums/kk197/captainvarundude/egerg.jpg[/img]

item.title: Help finding area/perimeter of shape! =O
item.dc:creator: @jose3121 jose3121
item.description:
@jose3121 wrote:

to find the area make the one shape into more shapes and find the formula for each shape

square = the length or height squared

rectangle = length times height
parallelogram = bh

trapezoid = h/2 (b1 + b2)

circle = pi r 2

Read full topic

item.title: Help finding area/perimeter of shape! =O
item.dc:creator: @lary370 lary370
item.description:
@lary370 wrote:

nade:

If you fucked up the circle, it makes me wonder what else you drew incorrectly. For all we know, the 24 and the 48 inch line are parallel to each other making a perfect rectangle from which you can subtract the area of the two bottom (incomplete) triangles.

its supposes to be a half circle so i think the area for the circle will be something times pi times 1/2…

Read full topic

item.title: Help finding area/perimeter of shape! =O
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:3, topic:334808”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=431205.msg3165847#msg3165847 date=1269999410]
P = 13 + 37 + 48 + 52.7 + 26 + 30 + 24
P = 230.7

You can’t find area without any other information.
[/quote]
you didnt consider the semi circle… which im assuming is supposed to be a perfect circle[/quote]
Oops, missed that.

Edit:

P = 37 + 48 + 52.7 + 26 + 30 + 24 + 6.5pi
P = 238.11

Read full topic
